message.content:
Bloodhound is a type of large scent hound that was originally bred for hunting deer and wild boar. They possess a very strong sense of smell.
Their coats are typically short and dense with colors ranging from black and tan to liver and tan. 
Bloodhounds have long, droopy ears and wrinkled faces with a sad expression. 
Their bodies are muscular and square in shape with a wide chest and powerful legs.
Bloodhounds are known for their distinctive baying howl when on the trail of a scent.
They are commonly used in law enforcement as tracking dogs due to their exceptional sense of smell and determination to follow a trail.
Bloodhounds are also popular pets due to their laid-back and affectionate personalities.
